sys:positions.title: Minister of Forest and Soil Conservation
Member of the 2nd Nepalese Constituent Assembly

description: Mahesh Acharya (Nepali: महेश आचार्य) is a Nepali politician who served as the Minister of Forest and Soil Conservation under the government of Sushil Koirala. A central member of the Nepali Congress, he won the Morang–6 seat in the 2013 Nepalese Constituent Assembly election. Acharya's political career began during the panchayat era, participating in anti-panchayat movements with leaders like Bishweshwar Prasad Koirala and Girija Prasad Koirala. He has also served as Nepal's Minister of Finance on two occasions, from 1991 to 1994 and from 1999 to 2001.
short_description: Nepali politician who is a central member of the Nepali Congress and has served as Minister of Forest and Soil Conservation and Minister of Finance.
tags: Minister of Forest and Soil Conservation
Member of the 2nd Nepalese Constituent Assembly
